titleInfo.title: LSU History Oral History Project: Alumni
titleInfo.subTitle: John Staples oral history interview, 1996

name.description: John Staples was born in 1924 in New Orleans, La., and attended Isidore Newman High School. He attended Louisiana State University in 1941, but was later sent to the Philippines during World War II. He returned to LSU after the war and worked for Borden for 39 years.

mods.abstract: Staples discusses his family; his attendance at LSU; his uncle, Charles Henry Staples, the influential head of the LSU Dairy Department; LSU presidents, deans, faculty, and influential students; his work with the athletic department; military training on campus; Kappa Sigma fraternity; and his service in the Philippines during World War II.
